result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Bittelman

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Scheduling
Amended Bond mailed to defendant for signature and return

*Not to be on the premises of any bars  *Not to possess any firearms, prior to release, the firearms need to be surrendered to Marquette County Sheriff's office or their designee  *No contact with any person under the age of 18 unless they are in the immediate company of a parent or guardian with the exception of his own children   *No use or possession of any device capable of accessing any type of internet activity or social media  *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol   *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  
***amended to include "May appear for Court Appearances via Zoom"

7/12/22:  Conditions modified:  Defendant is permitted to use any device necessary to review discovery germane to this proceeding in the presence of his counsel.  Defendant will also be permitted to use any device necessary to complete any assessment under the direct supervision of his therapist.

12:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis Bittelman appeared by phone.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared by phone for Travis Bittelman.
Court questions defendant who waives his right to appear for today's hearing in person.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds wavier is being made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
Court advises defendant of charges and maximum penalties.  Defendant received the Information.  Atty Riek waives the reading of the Information.  Defendant enters Not Guilty plea to all charges.
BY THE COURT:  Set for FPT.  Defense motions by 9/15/22 and State's motions by 10/1/22.  Court also requires all Proposed Jury Instructions and Verdict forms.

Atty Riek states motion for bond modification.  Atty Lippert responds.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will modify the bond as follows:  Defendant is permitted to use any device necessary to review discovery germane to this proceeding in the presence of his counsel.  Defendant will also be permitted to use any device necessary to complete any assessment under the direct supervision of his therapist.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Treatment/SDI Assessment Letter

01:03 PM Defendant Travis Bittelman appeared by phone.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared by phone for Travis Bittelman.  Attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant.  Defendant waives his right to personal appearance.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant is freely, voluntarily & intelligently waiver his right to personal appearance.
Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant as to that waiver and finds it is being made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Set for Arraignment by phone.
Arraignment scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 12:00 pm.
Arraignment on July 12, 2022 at 12:00 pm.
and Motion for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List
Discovery from DA

12:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis Bittelman appeared by phone.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared by phone for Travis Bittelman. 
NOT ON THE RECORD:  Atty Riek states at their intention is to waive preliminary hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Set for telephonic waiver of preliminary hearing and arraignment.
Atty Riek makes statement regarding motion for bond modification.
BY THE COURT:  That will be held at the same time as well.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 12:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: for Substitution of Judge - approved s/ MTS
Judge Slate will take no action on this motion as Request for Sub. of Judge requested (Motion submitted on same date as Sub request)

*Not to be on the premises of any bars  *Not to possess any firearms, prior to release, the firearms need to be surrendered to Marquette County Sheriff's office or their designee  *No contact with any person under the age of 18 unless they are in the immediate company of a parent or guardian with the exception of his own children   *No use or possession of any device capable of accessing any type of internet activity or social media  *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol   *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  
***amended to include "May appear for Court Appearances via Zoom"

1:04 PM Defendant Travis Bittelman in court.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek in court for Travis Bittelman.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Riek states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Riek states that the birth year is wrong, should be 1981.  
BY THE COURT:  Clarified date of birth is 1981.

Atty Lippert objects to the bond modification and makes arguments.  Atty Riek makes additional arguments.  

BY THE  COURT:  Court denies the bond modification request.

Atty Riek waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.
Bond to be amended for the defendant to be allowed for zoom appearances for court hearings.
Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
